meanings.definition: A playing card with a single spot on it, ranked as the highest card in its suit in most card games.
meanings.sent1: In the game, I drew an aces and won the round.
meanings.sent2: She laid down her aces, winning the hand.
meanings.sent3: The aces in the deck seemed to have a lucky charm.
meanings.sent4: His strategy was like holding all the aces in a game of cards.
meanings.sent5: The aces in the deck gleamed under the bright lights of the casino.

meanings.definition: To perform very well or excellently in a particular activity or endeavor.
meanings.sent1: He aces every test he takes.
meanings.sent2: She aces her piano recitals effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat aces the art of napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: She aces the dance routine with grace and precision.
meanings.sent5: He aces the job interview, impressing the panel with his skills.

meanings.definition: To score a perfect grade or achieve a perfect result in a test or examination.
meanings.sent1: She aces every math test without fail.
meanings.sent2: He aces the spelling bee competition every year.
meanings.sent3: The student aces the history exam, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: She aces the driving test on her first attempt.
meanings.sent5: He aces the science project presentation, leaving the class in awe.
